trans-unit.source: Possible Solution
• Company Name
Gather Data from the Customer

Is the laptop plugged in?
Is the power switch turned on?
Have there been any power outages?
Are all the cables connected?
Is the battery secure?
Can the laptop operate with an AC power connector?
Can the laptop operate using a battery?
Possible Solution
A laptop user complains that numerous peripheral cables are constantly getting tangled.
Provide information to the user about cordless peripherals.
A laptop user cannot connect to the wireless network at their Academy.
Reconfigure the wireless security on the laptop to connect to the security system used at the Academy.
The laptop keyboard no longer works.
The keyboard is a FRU, advise the customer to take the laptop to a repair center or return it to the manufacturer.
A user reports that her laptop battery needs recharging more frequently than when it was new.
Have the user completely discharge the battery, then fully recharge it.
A user obtains a new laptop and reports that it does not fit in the existing docking station.
Docking stations are proprietary, verify the user has a compatible model.
System runs for a few minutes then locks up
Check fan power cable, verify fan operation, verify thermal compound properly applied

Replace the AC power adapter with a known good AC power adapter
Remove and reinsert the battery
Replace battery with a known good battery

Discuss the solution implemented with customer
Have the customer verify that the problem has been solved
Provide customer with all paperwork
Document steps taken to solve the problem in the work order and the technician’s journal
Document any components used in the repair
Document the time spent to resolve the problem
